intro: Chaetogastra adenophora, commonly known as the hairy bladderpod, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in racemes. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, typical of the mustard family. It is often found in dry, disturbed soils and is native to parts of North America.
